items.sentence: I\'d like it if you would clean this room before I get back.
I want to travel this summer, but I don\'t know where to go.
Tom gave me a couple of slices of toast and a glass of milk.
Tom got to work later than usual this morning. I wonder why.
Tom has a cast iron stomach. He can eat just about anything.
Tom has had trouble walking ever since he was six years old.
Tom is the only person that has any chance to persuade Mary.
Tom played the piano for three hours without taking a break.
I can\'t concentrate if you keep tapping me on the shoulder.
Will you please talk to Tom and try to convince him to help?
Would you consider taking care of my children next Saturday?
Would you like to come over for dinner after work on Monday?
Would you mind staying home and taking care of the children?
Would you rather drink wine with your mother or your father?
Tom rescued the dog from being eaten by the hungry soldiers.
Tom said he felt rested and was ready to start hiking again.
Tom said he read a lot of interesting books over the summer.
Tom said he was going to try out for his school soccer team.
Tom called to say that he couldn\'t attend today\'s meeting.
A water molecule has two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.
